poem:
The Weight of Years

In Gaza, time wears the face  
of a weary hourglass,  
each grain a century—  
sand swept by the breath of war.  
The sky, a patient witness,  
counts not the stars,  
but the years,  
whispering the slow return  
of what is cracked and buried  
beneath the ruin.  
A cycle of sun and shadow.
